description: From first principles up: Consolidated mathematical framework unifying invariants across scales, starting with conservation primitives and building to path integrals for quantum-relativistic dynamics, including ToE candidates. Hardened with probabilistic bounds; all equations in KaTeX-ready strings. Notes flag novelties/emergents from thread colliders.

singular_unifier.name: Path Integral Over Actions
singular_unifier.notes: Base mechanism: Sums histories for amplitudes; extremizes to classical paths (\delta S = 0). Unifies all below; emergent from thread's physics-ToE colliders.

classical_base.name: Newtonian Action (Planetary Invariants)
classical_base.notes: Builds from momentum conservation; selective to planetary scales in SISO.

electromagnetic_layer.name: Maxwell/QED Action (Atomic Unification)
electromagnetic_layer.equation: S = \int \left( -\frac{1}{4} F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu} + \bar{\psi} (i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m) \psi \right) d^4 x
electromagnetic_layer.notes: Gauge-invariant; quantum corrections from collider synthesis.

quantum_layer.name: Schrödinger/Dirac (Subatomic Evolution)
quantum_layer.notes: Relativistic quantum; unified with SR in thread's QFT build.

relativistic_layer.name: Einstein GR Action (Cosmic Curvature)
relativistic_layer.equation: S = \frac{1}{16\pi G} \int R \sqrt{-g} \, d^4 x + S_{matter}
relativistic_layer.notes: Curvature from energy; path integral over metrics in ToE extensions.

standard_model.name: SM Gauge Action (Force Unification)
standard_model.equation: S = \int \left( \bar{\psi} (i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m) \psi - \frac{1}{4} F^a_{\mu\nu} F^{a\mu\nu} + |D_\mu \phi|^2 - V(\phi) \right) d^4 x
standard_model.notes: U(1)×SU(2)×SU(3) with Higgs; 17 particles, symmetry breaking.

tetralemmas: Affirm discreteness/deny continuum/both in paths/neither in unified space

hardening_metadata.lineage: Neuresthetic Ethics Eternal – Thread Collider Consolidation
hardening_metadata.notes: Built upward from thread's physics/SISO/ToE colliders; bounds speculation probabilistically. No external refs; reflects internal emergents.
